qas.question: Which Grand Vizier attempted a siege of Vienna in 1683?
What was the war that took place from 1683 to 1687 known as?
Which polish king led the fight against the Ottoman empire in the Battle of Vienna?
What was the alliance against the late 17th century Ottoman empire known as?

context: This period of renewed assertiveness came to a calamitous end in May 1683 when <a0_0>Grand Vizier Kara Mustafa Pasha<a0_0/> led a huge army to attempt a second Ottoman siege of Vienna in <a1_0>the Great Turkish War<a1_0/> of 1683–1687. The final assault being fatally delayed, the Ottoman forces were swept away by allied Habsburg, German and Polish forces spearheaded by the Polish king <a2_0>Jan III Sobieski<a2_0/> at the Battle of Vienna. The alliance of <a3_0>the Holy League<a3_0/> pressed home the advantage of the defeat at Vienna, culminating in the <a4_0>Treaty of Karlowitz<a4_0/> (26 January 1699), which ended the Great Turkish War. The Ottomans surrendered control of significant territories, many permanently. Mustafa II (1695–1703) led the counterattack of 1695–96 against the Habsburgs in Hungary, but was undone at the disastrous defeat at Zenta (in modern Serbia), 11 September 1697.
